loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 33 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Geraldine is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from selling bananas.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Angelita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old, married, and has one child.

She earns a living by farming calamans (a citrus fruit)i in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelly has been farming calamansi for 8 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  Nora is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for 6 years and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rolyn

texts.en:
Rolyn is 40 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rolyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  Rolyn has been in this business for seven years.  In the future, Rolyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Jean has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Jean would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Villa Bonita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita está en su ciclo número 10º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, con el que conocen la situación de cada una.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith, quien además de ser la tesorera del grupo, se dedica a la lavandería, y es ella misma la que maneja el negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabones, suavizantes, y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y ayudar a su familia, como también mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called "Emprendedoras de Villa Bonita" is in its 10th cycle of the women's committee program, where every woman works and helps each other  get ahead in life.  They are carrying out a poverty elimination survey in order to understand each other's situation.

One of the members is Señora Edith, who in addition to being the treasurer of the group makes a living through a laundromat, which she operates herself.  She is a very hard-working person who fights to get ahead in life and to help her family.

She asks for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of soap, softener, and other supplies to continue with her work and support her family, as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to buy soap, softener, and other supplies.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Kuña Pora inicia el 1er. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que quieren ayudar a sus familias por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto de todas.
La Sra. Diana es la presidenta del grupo ella es docente y desea realizar trabajos de manualidades, es madre de 1 niño pequeño, ella  se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, pinturas,  hilos y demás insumos para poder hacer las manualidades que quiere vender. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ellas están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The Kuña Pora group is starting its first loan cycle. These are very hardworking women who want to help their families together. Diana is the group's president. She is a teacher and wants to make crafts. She has a baby son and goes the extra mile to become a successful woman, and she is working continuously to get there. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics, dyes, thread and other supplies to make the crafts that she wants to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity this group is receiving; it will be a big help.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, dyes, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin, 32 years old, lives with her spouse and three children in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. All of her children still depend on her income and care. Sin, together with her husband, cultivates their own farm, primarily growing rice both for sustenance and sales. Her husband also goes fishing for additional income during the high-water season.

Sin has nearly two hectares of rice. She needs to transplant her rice crop and apply fertilizer. Because she has inadequate capital, she would like to request a loan of KHR 800,000 to hire people to work on her farm and to buy fertilizer for her rice crop. She also plans to continue working in agriculture but hopes to expand a larger area for cultivation.

loans.use: to hire people to work on her farm and buy fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Alona works hard to support her family.  She has a ginger business in the Philippines.   Alona earns additional income from selling root crops and from a general store.  Alona is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.  Jessica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials, such as bamboo and paints. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and paints for her furniture business.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Kuña Katupyry está iniciando el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas y cada una de ellas está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Marta es la presidenta del grupo, ella es artesana, tiene 2 hijos y vive en casa propia, se dedica a trabajar la lana, haciendo todo tipo de artículos de ese producto. Ella se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de lana, lo que le permitirá seguir creciendo y ayudando por medio de sus ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: The Kuña Katupyry group is beginning its first loan cycle in the program for enterprising women, and all of the members are giving their best effort to grow and make headway. Marta is the group's president. She is an artisan, has two children and lives in her own home. She makes a living working with wool, making all kinds of items with it. She goes the extra mile to become a successful woman, and is getting there through nonstop work. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wool, which will allow her to keep growing her business and earning income to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase wool to make crafts.

loans.name: Salimakhon

texts.ru:
Салимахон жительница города Конибодом, ей 59 лет. Она шьет национальные ватные одеяла. С давних времен ватные одеяла и подушки были необходимыми бытовыми принадлежностями таджикского народа. До сегодняшних дней они пользуются популярностью. Ватные одеяла для зимних холодов необходимая вещь. Многие века таджики пользуются ими и не собираются променять их на новые синтетические покрывала.
   Салимахон около 9 лет шьет такие одеяла. Научилась хитростями шитья от мамы. Салимахон сверху одеял шьет красивые ткани, чтобы зимой не только было тепло, но и красиво. С каждым днем новые виды тканей и материалов привозят в город. И Салимахон просит кредит, чтобы купить красивые ткани. Это поможет ей найти новых и постоянных клиентов.
texts.en: Salimakhon lives in the city of Konibodom and is 59 years old.  She sews quilted folk blankets.  For a long time quilted blankets and pillows have been necessary household items of the Tajik people, and to this day they remain popular.  Quilted blankets are necessary items during the cold winter.  For many decades the Tajik people have used these blankets and they do not plan on giving them up for new synthetic blankets.  Salimakhon has been sewing blankets for about 9 years, and learned to sew from her mother.  Salimakhon sews the top parts of the blanket with beautiful fabrics so that winter won't be simply warm, but also pretty.  Each day new types of fabric and materials arrive in the city, and Salimakhon is asking for a loan to purchase beautiful fabric.  This will help her to find new and regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to sew quilted blankets

loans.name: Ángela Victoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 13 y 11 años de edad, los  tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un barco pesquero.
Doña Ángela es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque en su casa también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales ofrece sus productos. Trabaja todos los fines de semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 4  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables. 
Su sueño es tener un barco propio.
texts.en:
The 24 de Diciembre Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial cultural and for its handicrafts, which are renowned both nationally and internationally. This is also the place of the famous panama straw hat.

This is where Sra. Angela lives. She is 36 years old and married. She and her husband have four children who are 16, 14, 13 and 11 years of age. The oldest three are in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband works on a fishing boat.

Doña Angela is a housewife who sells all kinds of clothing in order to earn her own income. She sells door to door and also has display cabinets in her home where she offers her wares. She works every weekend and allows her customers to buy on credit and collects from them every week. She purchases her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to. She has had this business for four years and started it with her first loan.

She will use this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been a member of  this communal bank for four years and she enjoys it because her colleagues are very responsible.

Her dream is to have her own boat.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son mujeres que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa, y es por eso que se han unido.
Una de ellas es Gloria, quien se dedica a la costura, y comenta que hace todo tipo de prendas y con ello cumple con los pedidos de sus clientes. Se ha hecho de una buena clientela, ya que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos que gustan a sus clientes. Tiene como sueño poder ir creciendo y poder dar trabajo a otras personas que al igual que ella quieren salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo su costura y cumpliendo con su clientela.
texts.en: This group is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's group program, and all of the members work and help each other to make headway. These women saw a great opportunity with this program, and that's why they all came together. One of the members is Gloria, who makes a living in sewing. She says that she makes all kinds of garments to fulfill her customers' orders. She has built a good clientele because she always makes very good items that her customers love. Her dream is to be able to keep growing and to be able to give work to others so they can also make headway. She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners and other supplies in order to keep sewing and satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, fasteners and other supplies.

loans.name: Sayfiddin

texts.ru: Сайфиддин жизнерадостный и добродушный мужчина в возрасте 43 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Сайфидин  обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он с юных лет помогал своему отцу в ведении бизнеса животноводства. И сам набрал опыт в ведении данного дела. На сегодня имея свою семью, он самостоятельно занимается животноводством, у него это хорошо получается. И от этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход, что позволяет ему удовлетворять все нужды своей семьи. Развивая этот бизнес, Сайфиддин хочет увеличить поголовье своего скота, а также построить коровник для своего скота.  Семья также помогает ему, жена  продаёт молоко, полученное от имеющегося скота. Сайфиддин хочет закупить ещё несколько голов скота для дальнейшего откармливания и продажи. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Sayfiddin is a cheerful and goodnatured man of 43.  He is married and has two children.  Sayfiddin turned to Arvand for financial support and wants a loan to purchase cattle.  Since he was young he helped his father in the business of animal husbandry, and gained a lot of experience.  Now that he has his own family, he works in animal husbandry on his own, and it is working out well.  He earns good money, which allows him to meet the needs of his family.  Sayfiddin wants to develop his business by increasing the number of cattle he owns and by building a barn for his livestock.  HIs family also helps him - his wife sells the milk from their cattle.  Sayfiddin wants to purchase a few more head of cattle, which he can fatten and sell.  He therefore turned to Arvand for a loan to purchase cattle.  He thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.ru: Эгамберди  добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Живёт он вместе со своим отцом, в его доме. Он с малых лет помогал отцу заниматься животноводством и земледелием и набрался большого опыта в этом деле. Его жена очень трудолюбивая женщина. Вместе со своей женой Эгамберди ведут бизнес животноводства. Он покупают малых телят, затем вскармливают их и продают мясо и молоко, полученное от этого скота. От этого бизнеса Эгамберди получает хороший стабильный доход. Также он выращивает  картошку, а потом продаёт. Хоть это и сезонный бизнес, но он также приносит хороший дополнительный доход. Эгамберди сотрудничает с Арванд с 2012 года и его жена рассказывает, что после того, как они стали сотрудничать с Арванд,  их  жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону. Получая прибыль от бизнеса, они смогли организовать свадьбу своего сына. Сейчас Эгамберды вновь обратился в Авранд и хочет получить кредит на покупку несколько голов скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Egamberdi is a good-natured and cheerful man of 30.  He is married and has two children.  He lives with his father in his father's home.  He has helped his father with animal-husbandry and agriculture since he was young, and has a lot of experience.  His wife is a very hard-working woman and Egamberdi and his wife are engaged in the business of animal husbandry.  He purchases young calves, fattens them, and then sells milk and meat from the full-grown cattle.  Egamberdi makes good money in this business. He also grows and sells potatoes, and, though this is a seasonal business, it also brings in good money.  In 2012 Egamberdi partnered with Arvand and his wife says that since then their lives have changed for the better.  With the profit from their business, they were able to put together a wedding for their son.  Egamberdi has again turned to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase several head of cattle to expand his business.  He thanks Arvand in advance for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jessenia Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessenia, tiene 25 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 1 años,  el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Jessenia es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio familiar, su esposo tiene un taller de ebanistería con el cual saca adelante a toda su familia, en su taller elabora puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, el trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares que saben del buen trabajo que realiza su marido y le piden que les realice sus obras, una de las cosas por cual a su esposo no le falta el trabajo es por el buen trabajo que realiza y por la responsabilidad ya que entrega lo que le pidan en el tiempo pactado, hay días que ella le ayuda para que el pueda cumplir en el tiempo correcto, el lleva 7 años con su taller y gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera para elaborar los muebles. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque así ella puede contribuir en los gastos del hogar. 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en: The "24 De Diciembre" [December 24th] Communal Bank meets once every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts, and home of the famous straw hats.  This is where Jessenia lives.  She is 25 and is married, and she and her husband have two kids aged eight and one, the older of which goes to school.  Her husband is a cabinetmaker.  Jessenia is a very good wife who wants to take out a loan for the family business.  Her husband has a cabinet making business which supports the whole family.  At his workshop he makes doors, beds, and all types of furniture.  Jessenia's husband works filling orders from customers who know he does quality work and order furniture they need from him.  One reason he always has work is that he does a good job, as well as because he is responsible, completing orders on time.  There are days when Jessenia helps him so he can finish a job on time.  He has had his workshop for seven years and thankfully has almost always had work.  This loan will be used to buy wood for making furniture.  Jessenia has been in the communal bank since its inception and she likes it because it allows her to contribute to household finances.  Her dream is to provide the best for her kids.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 51 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Antonina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. Antonina requested a loan of PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, shampoo, chips, sardines, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, shampoo, chips, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mercedita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling split bamboo in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Mercedita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo to sell for her business.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old, married and has four children. All of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Janet has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Janet requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Janet has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 40 years old and married with three children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jeaneth

texts.en:
Jeaneth is 29 years old and married with three children.

Jeaneth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Jeaneth has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut fruit.

Jeaneth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Jenny has been in this business for 7 years. Jenny earns more income from farming rice.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

Gemma has been raising pigs for 9 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
27-year-old Yasin is a driver. He is single and lives in the Abseron region with his parents. Yasin and his family are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fizuli city. He has lived in Dilegarda village of Füzuli region since childhood. His elderly parents don’t work.

It was noted that Yasin is a driver, transporting people between various sides of the Fuzuli region for 4 years. His car is broken and he can’t work. For this reason he applied to Kiva partner organization Komak to take a loan. With this loan he will repair his car. He needs 1,100 AZN to repair his car. He hopes that if his car will be repaired, he will start to work again.

Yasin thanks Komak and Kiva for help. In the future if the work is better, Yasin wants to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 30-year-old married man who lives with his wife. They have one child. He is the main income earner of the family. 

Saleh has been repairing photo-cameras, televisions, and other electronics for more than 13 years. Over the years, he has been able to build a good number of clients because of his friendly personality and competent repairing services. He also sells the electronics he repairs. 

Today, Saleh is asking for a loan from Kiva partner VFAC to purchase equipment for the repair of electronics to reach his clients order more quickly, to increase his revenue, and to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase electronic repair equipment.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 45 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Melba has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Melba is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed.

loans.name: Loriana

texts.en:
Loriana is married with 3 children. She is 44 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines.

Loriana is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other agrivet supplies such as veterinary medicines, vaccines, equipment, accessories, and all other agrivet products.
 
Loriana has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other agrivet supplies such as veterinary medicines, vaccines, equipment, accessories and all other agrivet products.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 69 years old and lives in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 children. 

Juanita has a hog-raising business and earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Juanita hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 23 years old. She is married and has a 1-year-old child. She owns a parcel of cocoland and her husband is a carpenter to sustain their daily consumption. During school days Juliet used to sell snacks and ice juice as her business, and thus earned 1,500 a month. She requested a new loan to purchase materials for their house. Juliet was a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC last year. She hopes and prays for a success.

loans.use: to purchase timber and various materials for her house.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Helen is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
Emmanueltiene 22 aaños viene de una Familia de comerciantes, su papa tiene una despensa y su mama tiene una Farmacia.
Él se animó y con la ayuda de su familia se independizo hace 1 año y pudo montar su propio negocio que es una despensa, comenta que le va muy bien en su local y que ya gano muy buena clientela. Comenta además que aprendió muchos de sus padres de cómo administrar y llevar adelante un negocio.
Está muy contento por la confianza que le dio la fundación paraguaya y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cerveza, Vino, gaseosas, harina, arroz, fideos, etc., lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Emmanuel is 22.  He comes from a family of retailers; his father has a convenience store and his mother has a pharmacy.  Emmanuel decided to move out a year ago and with his family's help was able to start his own business, which is a general store.  He also says he learned a lot from his parents about how to run and improve a business.  He is very happy about Fundación Paraguaya's trust in him, and he requests this loan to purchase beer, wine, soft drinks, flour, rice, pasta, etc. which will be very helpful to him in continuing his sales.

loans.use: to buy beer, wine, soft drinks, flour, rice, pasta, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está iniciando su primer ciclo del programa de comités, donde todas y cada una está dando su mayor esfuerzo por crecer. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer en la situación que cada una se encuentra, y conforme a ello poder seguir trabajando.
Emilce forma parte de este grupo y con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su negocio de venta de bebidas en general. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lo demuestra por medio de su sacrificio y su esfuerzo. Comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que sus ventas cada vez van mejorando. Ella quiere poder seguir creciendo para poder continuar ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y demás bebidas que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas y a la vez seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is starting their first loan cycle in the committee program, where each and every one of them is putting in their best effort to grow.  They are doing the elimination of poverty survey to learn about the situation each one of them is in, and in alignment with that, they will be able to continue working.  
Emilce is part of this group and with a lot of effort she was able to set up a business selling beverages.  She is a very hardworking person, as demonstrated by her sacrifice and efforts.  She tells us that the business is going very well and her sales are improving all the time.  She wants to be able to continue growing so she can continue helping her family like she has been.  She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of beer, wine, soft drinks and other drinks so that she can continue her sales and at the same time improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine, soft drinks, and other drinks for sale.

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Orquideas está en su ciclo número quinto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para poder trabajar conforme a ello e ir mejorando su nivel de ingresos.
Limpia es una persona digna de destacar, ya que por medio de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, que gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido ir mejorando. Comenta que al principio le fue muy difícil poder empezar, pero hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y quiere poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, panificados, lácteos y demás insumos para poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes. Limpia esta agradecida por la gran oportunidad que recibe, ya que podrá seguir mejorando su emprendimiento por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Las Orquideas group is in its 5th loan cycle in the committee of women program.  They are doing the elimination of poverty survey in order to use the results to direct their efforts and to improve their income levels.

Limpia is a noteworthy person because due to her efforts she is making progress.  She has a well-stocked shop that thanks to her hard work she has been able to improve.  She says that at the beginning it was very hard to get started, but today she has a very good clientele and she wants the business to keep growing.  She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, baked goods, dairy products and other items to be able to continue offering a good selection to her customers.  Limpia is thankful for this important opportunity, because she is able to continue improving her business through her work.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, baked goods, dairy products and other items to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three hectares of manioc to process

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Este grupo gracias a su trabajo ya está en su ciclo número 8, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo están tratando de salir adelante y dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Mirtha a través de su esfuerzo y trabajo continuo se encuentra mejorando su economía y por consiguiente la de su familia. Ella se dedica a hacer comidas que vende ella misma, y por medio de eso tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela y va mejorando día a día ya que sus comidas son muy ricas.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de sus ingredientes para la venta de comestibles, ya que quiere comprar carne, condimentos, verduras, harina, huevo y demás, que son los que más utiliza para poder hacer sus comestibles. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus compañeras están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Thanks to their work, this group is in its 8th loan cycle.  These women are heads of household, through their work and efforts that are trying to get ahead and help their children have everything that they could not.

Mirtha, though effort and continuous work, is improving her financial situation and that of her family.  She makes homemade meals which she sells.  This provides her with income to be able to help her family.  She tells us that she has a very good clientele and it is improving daily because her meals are very delicious.  Mirtha is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for the sale of meals.  She wants to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, flour, egg, etc. all of which are items that she uses the most to make her dishes.  She is thankful for the help she and her colleagues are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables, flour, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa se formó en la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní, donde las integrantes son mujeres que hacen actividades eminentemente rurales. Ellas viven en un lugar bastante lejano, y con poco acceso, más en tiempo de lluvia, y quieren poder mejorarlo.
Todas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, ovejas, cerdos y demás que crían y luego venden, y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias. Angela es una de ellas, quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante.
Hoy ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y así seguir con su trabajo y luchar por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The Kuña Guapa group was formed in a community of the city of Santaní, where the members are women who do primarily rural activities.  They live in a very remote area with poor access, especially during the rainy season, and they want to improve it.  All of the women raise and sell animals such as hens, sheep, pigs and other animals.  They raise them and then sell them, and in this way help their families.  Angela is one of the women in the group, who is making progress with much sacrifice and effort.  Today she is requesting a loan to purchase feed for her animals so that she can continue working and fighting to help her family.

loans.use: to purchae animal feed.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice cream making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her ice cream making business.

Lerma has been in the ice cream making business for 6 years and she also runs a general store.

Lerma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her ice cream making business

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is 48 years old and is a very responsible man with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and three children. He is a farmer of rice and corn.

Dionisio wants to increase his harvest as well as sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table for his household.

loans.use: To buy seeds, compost and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Marjorie has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
Lolie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. for her general store business.

Lolie has been in this business for 15 years and she also works in the rice trade.

Lolie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her trisikad.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years. Rosalie earns more income from variety store.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Glency

texts.en: Glency is a 40-year-old dependable and hardworking woman. For more than six years, she has been operating a general store in her community. She is very thankful for having this business because it helps her a lot in improving their living situation. Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more groceries such as biscuits, salt, candies, shampoo, soap and canned goods. With this amount, she is sure that this will convey better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as biscuits, salt, candies, shampoo, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Rosie is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad, actualmente se dedica a vender mercancía entre sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside, ofrece artículos como jeans, blusas, chaquetas, camisetas, entre otros y los recursos que obtiene los utiliza para aportar al sostenimiento de su familia. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años y aprendió de una amiga que también se dedica a esta labor. Su espíritu de superación y progreso la impulsan para buscar alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por esto solicita el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, camisetas, medias), así podrá abastecerse lo suficiente para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada navideña que se aproxima, reduciendo costos y por ende aumentando el margen de ganancia por cada venta, lo que para ella significa tener rentabilidad. Viviana como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria, desea seguir trabajando fuertemente para llegar a cumplir su sueño de montar un almacén en un local comercial, donde podrá ofrecer todos los productos al público en general y así abrirse paso para disfrutar con su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Viviana is a single mom with a two-year-old child.  She currently sells merchandise to her family, friends, and neighbors in the area where she lives.  She offers items such as jeans, tops, jackets, and t-shirts, among other things, and she uses the money she makes to help support her family.  She has been in this business for two years and she learned from a friend who does the same kind of work.  Her spirit of self-improvement and progress drive her to search for options that will allow her to keep moving forward, so she is requesting a loan to use to buy merchandise in bulk (tops, jeans, t-shirts, stockings).  This will allow her to stock up enough to satisfy the increased demand during the upcoming Christmas season, reducing her costs and ultimately increasing her profit margin on each sale, which means a return on her investment.  Viviana, like all enterprising and visionary women, wants to continue working hard to achieve her dream of having a shop where she could sell all her products to the general public.  This would be a path to a higher quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (tops, jeans, t-shirts, stockings)

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en:
Mahammad lives Fuzuli region. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Füzuli city. He is married and has three daughters, ages 23, 18 and 16 years old. His oldest daughter is engaged; his other daughters are students. 

He began to work 15 years ago. He is a farmer. Mahammad is in a cattle-raising business. He earns income from selling cattle meat. He wants to repair his little farm. He needs 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to repair his farm for winter, that's the reason Mahammad has applied to the Kiva organization. He thanks Kiva for helping him again. In the future, he wants the marriage of his other daughter; for business, he dreams to grow up his cattle business.

loans.use: to repair his farm for winter

loans.name: Mbaapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mbaapora está en el cuarto ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Curuguaty,  la cual es muy alejada de la zona céntrica y se encuentra en crecimiento, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Irene es una de las integrantes, quien tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas de ropas, y con lo cual está luchando por dar a su familia todo lo que desean. Ella quiere que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Irene solicito de este crédito para la compra de ropas para ampliar su trabajo y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes todo lo que le piden y también poder seguir creciendo con su negocio
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mbaapora" is in its fourth loan cycle through the women's program in the city of Curuguaty.  It is a remote area, far from the center area and in a phase of expansion so the members of the group want to work toward growth and a better environment.

Irene is one of the members of the group, and she earns a living for her family with a small clothing business.  Her aim for the future, with the help of everyone in the area, is to improve the environment so families here will have more safety and a better future.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing so she can increase her work and continue offering her customers everything they order.  She wants to continue growing her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Xasay

texts.en:
Xasay is a farmer and he is 33 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Füzuli city and now lives in Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. He was married for 11 years. He has a daughter. She is 9 years old and is in third class at school.

Xasay has been raising cattle, like cow and buffalo, for 6 years. He buys young cattle, raises them, and resells them in the local bazaar. He wants to buy more cattle for his farm. For this reason he need 1400 AZN, and by this aid he develops his business. Therefore, he has applied to Kiva organization for a loan. He is thankful to Kiva for help. In the future he wishes to develop his industry, increase his income, and to give his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Vicente” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad bastante alejada y a la cual las personas tienen difícil acceso, y si se puede decir poca seguridad. Están en el Cuarto siglo, trabajan en conjunto para ayudarse  y cada una de ellas quiere ir mejorando su vida.
Felicita es integrante de este grupo, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y cuenta que está yéndole cada vez mejor ya que sus clientes siempre le hacen pedidos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que sueña con poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y así evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Felicita solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, bermudas y demás, para poder surtirse y seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece también por la ayuda que ellas y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Vicente" was put together by several neighbors of Santaní, a remote city with difficult access and poor safety conditions.  The group is in its fourth cycle and the members all help each other to improve their lifestyles.

Felicita is a member of the group and sells a variety of clothing for a living.  She says business is getting better and better because she always has orders from customers.  She is a very hard worker who dreams about giving her family everything she was unable to have so they will not be lacking for anything.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothing such as capri pants, shirts, pants, bermudas and other items so she will have inventory and be able to offer a wide variety of goods to her customers.  She is grateful for the help she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing such as capri pants, shirts, pants, bermudas, etc.

loans.name: Sanoatkhon

texts.ru: Саноатхон 27 лет. Она живет недалеко от города Душанбе в районе Рудаки. Саноатхон замужем за строителя. У них трое детей. Саноатхон домохозяйка, но сидя дома не сидит без дел и сама зарабатывает, предоставляя услуги портнихи. Она давняя рукодельница, шить и кроить научилась еще учась в школе. Но профессионально занимается этим делом уже 3 года. Саноатхон принимает заказы, смело воплощает свои идеи на ткани и своим талантом делится с другими девочками. Соседские девочки очень хотят научиться шить, но не имеют швейной машинки. Саноатхон хочет на деньги от кредита купить машинку и научить девочек пользоваться швейной машинкой, швейными приборами, шить, кроить и делать вышивки. Естественно за это она будет получать дополнительный доход и ее сфера деятельности расширится.
texts.en:
Sanoatkhon is 27 years old. She lives not far from the city of Dushanbe, in the Rudaki region. Sanoatkhon is married to a builder. They have three children. Sanoatkhon is a housewife, but is not sitting at home without anything to do, she earns money herself. She provides a sewing service. She has been a seamstress for a long time. She learnt cutting and sewing already when she went to school. She has worked professionally with this activity for 3 years already. 

Sanoatkhon takes orders and boldly realizes her ideas on fabric and shares her talent with other girls. The neighboring girls would very much like to learn to sew, but does not have sewing machines. Sanoatkhon would like to use the money from the loan to purchase a sewing machine and teach the girls to use a sewing machine, sewing devices, sew, cut and do embroidery. Naturally from this she will receive additional income and expand the scope of her activities.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for expanding her business

loans.name: Maknuna

texts.ru: Макнуна родилась в 1985 года. Она замужем  и на воспитании имеет 1 дочь. Макнуна является студенткой 6 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса в факультете Финансы и кредит. Макнуна работает в государственном учреждении бухгалтером. Она учится в заочное отделение. Макнуна является успешной и на работе и в университете. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Первый займ она получала для оплаты 5 курса. Второй кредит она запрашивает для оплаты договора 6 курса. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Maknuna was born in 1985. She is married and is raising a daughter. Maknuna is a sixth-year student at Tajik State University of Politics and Business in the department of Finance and Credit. Maknuna works in a government agency as an accountant. She is a part-time student. Maknuna does well both at her job and at university. She is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She received her first loan for her fifth-year tuition. She is requesting her second loan to pay for her sixth-year tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Sarbiniso

texts.ru: Сарбинисо родилась в 1985 года. Она старается улучшить условию проживания и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Сарбинисо решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница, картошка, помидор и т.п. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки семена, минерального удобрения, а также оплатить за аренду земли, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sarbiniso was born in 1985.  She is trying her best to improve her quality of life and bolster her family's finances.  She is married and currently raising 4 children.  Her husband is a simple worker and does not make much money; his salary is not enough to provide the family with all the necessities of life.  For the sake of her family, Sarbiniso has decided to set up a new business; she wants to start her own farm, growing crops such as wheat, potatoes, and tomatoes among others.  With this goal in mind, she has taken a course organized by an association for businesswomen titled "Attain Success", and received a certificate upon completing the course.  She hopes to use the profits from her prospective farm to provide her children with a good education as well as to make sure her children have plenty of filling, nourishing food to eat.  She is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers, as well as to rent a plot of land for her new business.  She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for rent land and to buy seeds and fertilizer for setting up a new farm

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She manages a piggery business and has been operating for over a year. She works very hard to provide for her family. Now, due to growing expenditures, Yolanda needs additional capital to continue to maintain her business. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase one piglet, feed, and vitamins. She believes that through her hard work in maintaining her livestock, she could give further care and nourish to her pigs, helping towards better cost when the pigs are sold.

loans.use: to purchase one piglet, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 41 years old, married, and lives in Bagumbang, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from the neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement. With a desire to earn more, Cheryl decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 
Through Pauglam PC Cheryl obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her piglets

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is married with 6 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban, Philippines.
Lea is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other pig raising equipment such as a black/green weed mat, a high speed slitting machine, water sprinklers, agricultural irrigation quick connect male elbow, etc.
Lea has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to improve more and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other pig raising equipment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with 1 child. Rosa is 55 years old and lives in Colambutan, Bajo, Philippines.
Rosa is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals for her corn crops, such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides, ovicides, etc.
Rosa has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Rosa hopes to improve her business for her to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other agricultural chemicals for her corn crops such as insecticides, pesticides, acaricides, ovicides, etc.

loans.name: Mardiosa

texts.en:
Mardiosa is 49 years old, a resident of Brgy. Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, who is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She is a farmer. She currently lives with her husband and three children.

Mardiosa wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda is 43 years old, a resident of Brgy. Caniangan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jolinda is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. Jolinda is a farmer. She currently lives with her husband and three children.

Jolinda wants to increase her sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan from lenders to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins. She has been in the business six months and would like to pursue it, with help from her requested amount of loan. In the future, Rose Ann would like to expand her business in order to save money for the future of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 39 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Arceli works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fishing materials and needed accessories, namely mud hole custom tackle, fishing rods, bait, reels, etc.
Arceli has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Arceli hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials and needed accessories, namely mud hole custom tackle, fishing rods, bait, reels, etc.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 
Milagros is engaged in coconut buying and copra trading activites and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coconuts for her existing business. 
Milagros became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Milagros hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Edith has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Edith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. Helen is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Helen has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

Helen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jonadil

texts.en:
Jonadil is 37 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living through pig fattening in the Philippines. Jonadil is borrowing 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonadil has been pig fattening for 7 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 57 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from boarding house rental. Rowena is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As the married parent of one child, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business buying and selling fish.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa is 47 years old and married with two children.

Eloisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Eloisa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from rice retailing and charcoal.

Eloisa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Maria Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a food vending business and selling natural medicines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad business.

Maria Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living through poultry in the Philippines. Prescilla is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy cracked corn and vitamins for her chickens.

Prescilla has been in the poultry industry for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cracked corn and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Regina has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from food vending.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melsida

texts.en:
Melsida is an experienced farmer from Masis village in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband, her daughter, her school-age son and her parents-in-law.

Melsida is a nurse. As her salary is very low, for more than 16 years she has engaged in cultivation of wheat and several fruits (peaches, apricots, figs and pears) to be able to meet the needs of her family. With the help of her husband, she sells the agricultural products in the local market. Melsida's husband works as a driver in the private sector. They work hard to be able to earn a living for the family. 

The family's agribusiness currently needs some investments. They need a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase fertilizers, to pay for harvesting services, to buy wheat seeds, to purchase cellophane for the greenhouse and to renovate the greenhouse. 

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Melsida was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Melsida and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pay for harvesting services, buy wheat seeds, and renovate the greenhouse.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 29 years old and he was born in Ijevan City. After graduating from school, he passed his military service. For some time, he has been a worker and, since 2007, he has established his own business-a clothes trading business. He also has a very nice habit; he likes singing very much (as you can see in photo) and after hard working day as he says it helps him to calm down and relax. Now Sasun is in Russian Federation and his mother has power of attorney for her son and temporally she runs his clothes trading business. Sasun sends products from there for sale. At the rented stall in the wholesale market, which is located in Ijevan city, woman’s clothes, underwear, towels, slippers and children's clothes are sold.

 Sasun asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy and send a lot of seasonal clothes for sale and on this way to develop his trading business.

loans.use: to buy and send a lot of seasonal clothes for reselling, which will help his mother to enlarge his business

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is a 23-year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Ten years ago she decided to start a drug shop after realising the need for the community to have medical services nearer, and has since reaped tangible benefits. She also practices farming and transport businesses in order to raise more income. The good mother that she is, Edreda desires to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification despite challenges of high licenses and cost of rent, while her business plan is to own a hospital. Edreda intends to use the loan facility to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie works hard to support her family. Annie is single and has a business selling seashells in the Philippines.

Annie requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more seashells to sell to customers.

Annie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from fishing and baking businesses.

In the future, Annie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seashells to sell to customers.

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
Romik lives in a very nice and rich with nature village Goght which is in Kotayk region. Romik is married and has two sons, who are already married and they live separately with their families. At this moment he lives with his wife who is unemployed and together with Romik they greatly manage their farming and agricultural activities. They have a very big and full of different sorts of nice, colorful pear trees. They are also engaged in swine breeding. In their farm they have four pigs and seven piglets. All his farm products (fruits and meat) Romik sells from his house to re-sellers or just to passengers.
Romik asks a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to repair the roof of his barn so to provide his pigs safe winter months.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his barn so to provide his pigs safe winter months

loans.name: José Wilson

texts.es: José es un hombre humilde, amable y trabajador, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años de edad, por los que lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante. Actualmente se dedica a laborar como maestro de construcción, pero sus primeros conocimientos en este campo los obtuvo gracias a un amigo que le enseñó cuando era joven y a quien le ayudaba en algunos contratos con los que poco a poco fue adquiriendo experiencia y técnicas que le han servido para desempeñar su labor actual. El crédito que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de herramientas (pala, sierras, serrucho, taladro) y materiales de construcción, así podrá capitalizar su negocio y continuar con su actividad generadora de ingresos. José solo desea seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia, para brindar a sus hijos una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is a humble, kind, hard-working man who lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 12 and 3, who he works hard for every day.  He is a building expert but first acquired his knowledge about the trade from a friend in his youth.  He would help working on contract projects and slowly obtained experience and techniques that serve him in his current job.

The loan he is requesting is to buy tools (shovel, saws, drill) and construction materials so he can capitalize his business and continue generating an income.  José wants to continue working for his family's well-being and to give his children a good education and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tools (shovel, saws, drill) and construction materials.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken is from Bambakashat village of the Armavir region. He lives with his wife, two small sons (7 and 4 years old), and his parents. 

Babken and his father work in the private sector, but unfortunately, their salaries are not enough to meet the needs of the family. Babken is also engaged in cattle breeding and in the cultivation of corn, sunflower, alfalfa and grapes. 

Babken currently needs to make some investments in his agribusiness to be able to meet the increasing needs of his family more effectively. He needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase three steers, some forage for the livestock, and to renovate the agricultural machinery. 

Babken has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, he was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history, and have no access to credit products. 

Babken and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase three steers, some forage for the livestock, and to renovate the agricultural machinery

loans.name: Hans Buchanan

texts.es: Hans Buchanan, tiene 46 años de edad, casado , tiene 1 hija, vive en una aldea del sector Lopez Arellano, Choloma, Cortes. El señor Hans, tiene un negocio de venta de pizza cacera, que las prepara junto con su esposa en casa, desde hace 4 años tiene  este negocio al que le dedica todo el dia. Su venta es ambulante, entrega a domicilio y por pedidos, las distribuye en una bicicleta, la pizza se vende bastante en la zona, ya que se consume a cualquier hora. Ha establecido buena clientela con los niños de las escuelas de la zona quienes las comen como merienda. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo por 9,000 lempiras para abastecerse de ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de pizzas, principalmente la harina que la compra al por mayor porque sale barato y se ahorra dinero, tambien va comprar manteca,salsina etc. Su sueño es llegar a tener un local fijo donde vender pizzas, y crecer en el negocio para ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Hans Buchanan, 46, is married and has a daughter.  He lives in one of the villages of the Lopez Arellano sector in Choloma, Cortes.  Hans has a pizza business at home that he and his wife have been running for four years, working all day.  He uses his bicycle to sell and makes home deliveries.  Pizza has a good sales volume in the area since it can be eaten at any time of the day.  He has a good customer base among the school children in the area who eat pizza for afternoon snack.

Hans is requesting a loan, his third, in the amount of 9,000 HNL, to buy pizza ingredients.  The main item will be flour, which he will buy wholesale in order to save money.  He will also buy shortening, sauce, etc.  His goal is to have a pizza shop one day and expand his business to help his daughter with her education.

loans.use: To buy goods such as flour, shortening, sauce and other pizza ingredients.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru:
Хуршеда трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 30 лет. Она родилась в городе Исфаре. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ее муж является строительным мастером и работает на заказ. Сама Хуршеда так как не имеет образования занимается откормом  и продажей скота. Муж конечно же ей помогает. Откорм скота приносит этой семье хороший доход и поэтому они стараются развивать этот бизнес. 
 У них трое детей и Хуршеда мечтает чтобы ее дети учились в хороших учебных заведениях и в будущем получили высшее образование. Для этого родители очень стараются и работают не покладая рук. На данный момент Хуршеда планирует купить несколько голов скота и увеличить свое стадо.  По совету знакомых она решила подать заявку на кредит и обратилась в организацию Арванд.
На полученный кредит Хуршеда хочет купить скот и надеется,что  Арванд ее финансово поддержит.
texts.en:
Khursheda is a hardworking woman. She is 30 years old. She was born in the city of Isfara. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a construction specialist and works on a by-order basis. As Khursheda does not have an education, she practices fattening up and reselling cattle. Her husband helps her, of course. Fattening up cattle brings good earnings to the family, which is why they are trying to develop this business. They have three children and Khursheda dreams that her children will study in good schools and will receive a higher education in the future. In order to achieve this, the parents do their best to work extremely hard. Currently, Khursheda is planning to buy several cattle to increase her herd. 

Under the advice of acquaintances, she decided to fill out an application for a loan and turned to the Arvand microcredit organization. With the received loan, Khursheda wants to buy cattle and hopes that Arvand will support her financially.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Olmakhon

texts.ru: Олмахон 43-летняя замужняя женщина и мать пятерых детей. У нее трое дочерей и двое сыновей. Олмахон 21 год своей жизни занимается скотоводством. Она сама ухаживает за коровами, убирается за ними, кормит и доит. Одновременно она  со своей семьей работает в дехканском хозяйстве, где занимаются выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры, в частности кукурузы, хлопка, лука, люцерны - корма для скота. Несомненно, такой тяжелый труд не остается без вознаграждения. Олмахон целеустремленная, трудолюбивая и к будущим планам она идет уверенно. В данный момент она собирается увеличить поголовья продаваемого скота и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она хочет закупить трех голов коров, а также запастись кормом для зимы. Она действительно нуждается в кредите.
texts.en: Olmakhon is a 43-year-old married woman and mother to five children. She has three daughters and two sons. Olmakhon has practiced animal husbandry for 21 years of her life. She takes care of the cattle, cleans up after them, feeds them and milks them all by herself. Simultaneously, she and her family work on a communal farm where they cultivate crops including corn, cotton, onions, and alfalfa (feed for cattle). Undeniably, this difficult work does not come without rewards. Olmakhon is self-motivated, hardworking, and confidently pursues future goals. She is currently planning to increase her number of cattle for resale, which is why she is requesting a loan. With the loan amount, she wants to buy three cows as well as provide feed for them for the winter. She is truly in need of this loan.

loans.use: to buy three cows and feed for them.
