Grimanesa ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche,galletas y dulces,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite galletas.
La socia que esta tapada con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Virgen Guadalupe.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de crianza de animales y negocio de venta de maiz.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the “Virgen Guadalupana” communal bank are located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department. 

The featured member, Señora Grimanesa, is 53 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She works in her shop selling groceries and necessary items such as rice, sugar, biscuits and sweets. She works from 6 am - 10 pm. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is asking for a loan to buy products for the grocery shop such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and biscuits.

The person in the picture whose face is concealed is not a member of the “Virgen Guadalupana” communal bank.
The person whose photo is added to the group took the photo after the group photo - he asked permission for work motives.
The other members work selling food, selling vegetables, raising animals and selling corn.

Señora Grimanesa is thankful to thos who are part of her dream through this medium, and is committed to paying her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store (rice, sugar, milk, oil and biscuits).

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín continúa con su profesión de carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica diferentes tipos de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, mesas, roperos, camas y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad Efraín requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, clavos, pintura y otras cosas más. 
  
Efraín  continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Efrain is still working as a carpenter and has a small shop located in his residence, where he makes wooden furniture, such as chairs, tables, dressers, and beds, among other things. In this occasion, Efrain needs a loan to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint, and so on. Efrain continues to work with the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" from the Arariwa Association, he is thankful for the opportunity given to him through this loan and commits to make repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, nails, paint and other.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella continua con la elaboración  de artesanía como por ejemplo chompas y frazadas pero también ahora está ayudando a su esposo en la elaboración de muebles de madera con el acabado de los muebles. 

En esta oportunidad Virginia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Virginia continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (La socia aparece en la fotografia junto con su esposo).
texts.en: Virginia continues living in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, and this is where she does all types of activities. She continues with making crafts, such as sweaters and blankets, but she also now is helping her husband make wood furniture by doing finishing on the furniture. At this time, Virginia requires a loan to buy more materials, such as wood. It has already been many years that she has worked in this business, and it has been going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. Virginia continues with the community bank “Mamacha Rosario” of the microfinance organization Asociación Arariwa, and she is thankful for the opportunity offered through this group. As a result, she promises to comply with repaying the loan according to the schedule. Virginia appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as wood.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Alejandrina continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales, económicas y familiares, ella continua con la venta de comida y con la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo fideos, azúcar, verduras, carne, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más. 

Alejandrina continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is grateful to the investors for the support they have offered and hopes they continue to support all of her fellow borrowers working with Asociacion Arariwa.  She still lives in the city of Huancarani where she carries out her personal, business and family activities. She continues with her work in agriculture and food sales. It has now been several years that she has been doing this work and it has been going very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.

At this time Alejandrina needs a loan so that she can buy more staple food items such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc. She still is with Asociacion Arariwa's "Mama Rosario" community bank and is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from them.  She pledges that she will make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy more basic household products such as noodles, sugar, vegetables, meat, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Celia continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades personales y económicas, ella continua  dedicándose a la cosecha, cultivo y a vender cereales como   por ejemplo trigo, cebada, moraya seca, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Celia requiere el préstamo para compra semillas y abonos, pues continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia is grateful to lenders for the support provided and wishes that they will keep supporting all members of the Asociación Arariwa. 

Celia still lives in the city of Huancarani, province of Huancarani, where she performs her personal and economic activities. She keeps working in agriculture, cultivating and selling cereals such as wheat and barley, dehydrated potatoes and corn, among others. She has worked in this business for several years and has been successful thanks to her hard work. 

Celia is now requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She is still a member of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" within the Asociación Arariwa, and feels grateful for the opportunity provided. She commits to repay as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jerez Mae

texts.en:
Jerez Mae is married with 1 child. She is 28 years old and lives in Bagumbang Bonifacio.

Jerez Mae sells gasoline to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase liters of gasoline for retailing.

Jerez Mae has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Jerez Mae hopes to own a gasoline station.

loans.use: To purchase liters of gasoline to sell retail

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 43 years old, married and has four children. She is engaged in a hog fattening business. She has been in this business for over six months and very much thankful that the business contributed a lot to her family's income. Now, Phoebe wants to access a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed, medicine and piglets. She hopes that she can produce more healthy pigs through the amount requested to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and piglets.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 46-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has three children.The youngest child is 15. 

She engages in a retail business. She sells products like food supplements, Vida juice, coffee and other vitamins. Her business started more than one year ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more products like coffee, food supplements and whitening products to maintain her inventory and cater to the customers' needs on time.

In the future, Brenda hopes to expand her retail business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more products like coffee, food supplements and whitening products.

loans.name: Rosegine

texts.en:
Rosegine is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Dban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. 

Rosegine is engaged in a sari-sari business in the market where she sells things such as vegetables, groceries and dried fish. Rosegine earns a monthly income of 18,000 PHP. 

She requested a new loan to purchase additional goods and vegetables. Rosegine has been a Cumi member of Paglaum since 2007. She hopes to earn more and save more from her business.

loans.use: to purchase various vegetables and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 29 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

She has been operating a livestock and fish selling business. She would like to increase the number of ducks but she feels financial insufficiency. This led Edlyn to request PHP 5,000 to buy more ducklings to care for. Part of the loan will be used to purchase fingerlings (small fish) that she will raise in her fishpond. 

With her determination, she’s able to develop her business but her desire to keep improving it and somehow become successful motivated her to borrow the loan.

loans.use: to buy more ducklings and fingerlings that she will raise in her fishpond.

loans.name: Chirel

texts.en:
Chirel is 28 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

Chirel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Chirel hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Annbell

texts.en:
Annbell is a single lady aged 26 years old and supporting three members of her family.  Her children are aged 8 and 3 years old.  She sells second-hand clothes in Kabarnet and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning an income of Kes 20,000.

She has now requested her second loan of Kes 30,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes for resale.  The profits she earns will be used as savings and also to repay the loan.

Her dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of second-hand clothing for sale

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 40 years. Marina earns additional income from fishing.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, chips, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 40 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school, so she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Alona has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to resell.

Alona has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine used the previous loan to buy local brew to sell. She is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda. For ten years, she has been selling local brew, and she has been able to pay for school fees for her children with the proceeds. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification despite her low income and high license fees. Her business dream is to install a liquor processing plant so as to add value to her product. Justine intends to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Dinalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Dinalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ginger.  Dinalinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Dinalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, está casada, tiene la edad de 41 años, y vive con su esposo que es su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar almacigo de café para sembrar. Ella posee un terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo y actualmente se encuentra vacio por lo cual quiere invertir en la comprar de almacigo para utilizar el terreno y sacarle mas provecho. Ella espera poder generar más producción para los próximos años y a su aumentar sus ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband who is her biggest priority. With this loan she will buy coffee seedlings to sow. She has a plot of land suitable for growing these crops and currently it is empty, which is why she wants to invest in buying seedlings to use the land and benefit from it. She hopes to be able to generate more production for future years and increase her income to have a better quality of life. 

This is the second loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and married with five children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from "nipa" (palm frond sheets) roofing.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. She has six children.  She operates a farm, which she has been doing for 20 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business. Her biggest challenge is bad weather.

Peninah is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry.  During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, she learned about asset funding. Peninah's highest monthly expense is farming costs. With the loan, she hopes to earn more income.

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peninah owns the following: cow, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. She has in the household a mosquito net and solar power but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Evelita

texts.en:
Evelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Evelita earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc. for her general store business.

Evelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to puchase additional stocks to sell like eggs, milk, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a native mats making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making bamboo sticks. 

Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials for making mats for her native mats making business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making mats.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a farmer who lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana growing region. He has two children. He has been doing this work for three years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poor local market." His biggest challenge is "Limited funds." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Nyabarati."

Jared was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "To fund this poultry project." He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Offers asset financing."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Jared replied that it will increase their income base.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jared owns a cow and poultry but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets, electricity and solar power but does not have running water, a sewing machine, a TV or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lily works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. 

Lily is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Lily has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has two children. Raed works hard to provide his family and cover the tuition fees for his children.

Raed is a spare parts seller. He owns a small shop where he sells spare parts for almost every type of vehicle. He established his business in 2008 and now he has a hired employee. His experience in this field and his wide knowledge of vehicles gave him a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Raed is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD which he will use to install an external ceiling and to increase his inventory. Raed is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and to increase his  inventory

loans.name: Wend Pa Gouin Group

texts.fr:
Mme LIZETA  est responsable du groupe WEND PA GOUIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 07personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation  (dolo) depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Manga et à Kokologho. Ses clients sont  les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de mil de 50kg et 04rangées de bois Pour la préparation du dolo (boisson local ou bière de mil).
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Lizeta is the representative of the Wend Pa Gouin group. She is married and the mother of 8 children, the oldest of whom is 40 years old, and the youngest of whom is 20 years old. None of them attend school, and Lizeta has 7 people in her care. She has been in the business of making dolo for 15 years. She stocks up in Manga and in Kokologho, and her customers are both men and women. She wants to purchase 2 50-kg bags of millet and 4 batches of firewood for making dolo (a local beverage of millet beer). She plans to reinvest her profits in her business, and hopes to expand her business and to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 50-kg bags of millet and 4 batches of firewood to prepare dolo (a local beverage of millet beer)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers who are weeding his garden  and  to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 58 años de edad,  tiene un grado académico de 3 grado, está casado.  Vive solo, debido a que su esposa y sus dos hijos quienes rondan las edades entre los 20 a 25 años, están en la ciudad capital, por el motivo que los hijos están estudiando 

El señor José cuenta con más de 25 años de experiencia, en las actividades agrícolas;  siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de milpa, también siembra sandillera de postrera, y desempeña otros tipos de trabajo. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de un vehículo, el cual utilizara para trabajar haciendo viajes, además piensa salir a vender la sandia que cultiva en temporada a otros lugares.
El señor planifica,  seguir trabajando la tierra, vender sus cosechas en otros lugares y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: José is 58 years old, married, and has completed school. He lives alone, because his spouse, as well as their two children (who are between 20 and 25) live in the capital, since the children are studying there. José has over 25 years of experience in agriculture. He sows 14 000 square metres of milpa crops, as well as watermelons on the side, and does other kinds of agriculture-related work. He will use the loan to buy a vehicle, which he will use to provide transportation services as well as to sell his produce farther away. He plans to keep working on the land, to sell his produce somewhere else, and to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle, which he will use to provide transportation services as well as to sell his produce farther away.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme KADIA à l’extrême droite fait le commerce d’habits.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des pagnes wax et tissus qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average aged 39 with three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayermai, one of the popular areas of Sikasso in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their second loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to satisfy their customers.
Mrs. Kadia, who is on the far right, sells clothing.
With her loan she plans to buy wax pagnes and textiles that she will resell retail in Sikasso from her stall where she works with her family selling to a clientele of men and women, for cash.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs CFA  some of which she will use to repay her loan and the interests and the rest she will save.

loans.use: To buy fabric and wax pagnes.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Mr MOUSSA est vers 1978 à ZANSO/KADIOLO. Père de 4 enfants et vivant chez lui même à Loulouni (arrondissement faisant partir du cercle de Kadiolo) troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène cette activité commerciale de vente de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, elle collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 3 ans maintenant, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une quantité importante de poissons pour satisfaire sa clientèle Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso. Les ventes sont faite à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes sur place et au marché. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa was born around 1978 in Zanso/Kadiolo. He is father to four children and lives in his own home in Loulouni (a district in Kadiolo, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). 

He has been selling fish for more than ten years now. His experience in this field has brought him a good reputation and he receives orders from a variety of customers.  In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy customer demand, he has therefore been collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, for three years, and his previous loans have been repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy a substantial amount of fish to satisfy customer demand. He gets his supplies in Sikasso and sells locally and at the market to a diverse customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan he expects to make an average monthly profit of 30,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay interest on his loan and he will invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Yanci Junieth

texts.es: Yanci Junieth 28 años de edad soltera con tres hijos menores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general, como: zapatos, sandalias, ropa, bolsos, cosmeticos entre otros mas, yanci vende en uno de los mercados del municipio desde muy temprano brindando un mejor servicios a sus clientes inicia su negocio con fondos propios,  tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al credito y al contado a clientes fijos, los cuales recupera semanal y quincenal, uno de sus sueños es poder comprar su casa propia y asi asegurarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos, el objtivo de este credito es para invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedades estilos de zapatos, sandalias, ropa entre otros mas, ella no maneja inventario en su casa debido a que todo lo mantiene en cuentas por cobrar.
texts.en:
Yanci Junieth, age 28, is single with three children who are minors. She comes from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.  She works selling general merchandise such as shoes, sandals, clothing, handbags, and cosmetics, among other items.  Beginning very early in the day, Yanci sells her merchandise in one of the markets of her town, giving her customers superior service. She began her business with her own funds.  She has both regular and occasional customers.  She offers credit to the regular customers, collecting payments from them weekly or biweekly.  

One of her dreams is to be able to buy her own house and, in this way, secure a better future for her kids.  The goal of this loan is to invest in her business with the purchase of a variety of styles of shoes, sandals, and clothing, among other items.  She doesn’t handle the inventory in her house due to the fact that she keeps everything in accounts receivable.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cosmetics, shoes, clothing, and handbags, among others.

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Mr SIAKA est en 1962 à ZANSO/KADIOLO, il est père de 7 enfants et vit chez lui même à Loulouni (arrondissement faisant partir du cercle de Kadiolo) troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Il mène cette activité commerciale de vente de céréales depuis plus de 30 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de divers clients. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 14 ans maintenant, les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter une quantité importante de céréales (maïs, mil et fonio) pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Il s’approvisionne à Loulouni et environnants. Les ventes sont généralement faite sur commande à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes sur place et au marché de Sikasso. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Siaka was born in 1962 in Zanso/Kadiolo. He is father to seven children and lives in his own home in Loulouni (a district in Kadiolo, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

He has been selling cereals for more than 30 years now. His experience in this field has brought him a good reputation and he receives orders from a variety of customers. In order to have the necessary resources to satisfy customer demand, he has therefore been collaborating with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, for 14 years, and his previous loans have been repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to buy a substantial amount of cereals (corn, millet and fonio) to satisfy customer demand. He gets his supplies in Loulouni and the surrounding areas. As a rule he sells to order locally and at Sikasso market to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan, he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000FCFA. This profit will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and he will invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MARIAM  en première position de la gauche vers la droite fait le commerce de bazin brodé dans ce groupe de femme.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des bazins brodés qu’elle revendra en détail à  Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Confiance ("confidence") group are married women who are on average 38 years old with 2 children each. They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

The women are on their first loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. Mariam, pictured first from left to right in the photo, is in the business of selling embroidered damask cloth. She plans to use her loan to purchase embroidered damask cloth that she will resell at retail in Sikasso at a stand and from door to door for cash, to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to repay the loan and its interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mlle Maimouna, âgée de 21 ans, est une jeune couturière qui pratique le métier depuis 2 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et vit encore chez ses parents.
Elle entreprend d’acheter une machine piqueuse et des tissus basins pour confectionner des ensembles au but de les exposer pour revendre. Maimouna possède une clientèle assez varie parmi laquelle ses cohabitant de quartier. 
Elle n’a pas de charges sinon ses besoins personnels et parfois de l’argent qu’elle remet  à ses parents pour les appuyer. Maimouna n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit au sein de l’IMCEC, et vient solliciter l’appui de ce dernier pour réaliser son vœu.
texts.en:
Maimouna, 21 years old, is a young seamstress who has been in business for 2 years. She is unmarried and has no children, and still lives with her parents. She wants to buy a sewing machine and damask fabric to sew clothing for resale. 

Maimouna has a wide customer base made up of those that live in her same neighborhood. She does not have anyone to support besides herself and the funds she sometimes gives to her parents to help support them. She has never received a loan from IMCEC before; she is requesting this support in order to help achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase damask fabric to sew and resell and to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Hamar

texts.en:
Mrs. Hamar is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her husband Hurmanbai works as handyman in a local school. Her son and daughter are university students. 

Hamar has been running a small cafeteria in the local market for four years and retail businesses in the market and local residents are her clients. She has to pay her children's tuition and living expense at university from her business profit and barely manages to break even. She needs to maintain her cafeteria to provide a hospitable environment to her clients and now requesting loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase tables and chairs for her cafeteria. She is a hardworking and tenacious person.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat products and to let his son to start his own business right next to his while learning from him

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan continua viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani y con la carpintería pues tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo roperos, camas, sillas, mesas y otras cosas más, él continua también con la venta de leña en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juan  requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero y clavos. 

Juan continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Juan continues living in the city of Huancarani and running his small carpenty workshop in his home where he makes all types of furniture, such as wardrobes, beds, chairs, tables and other things. He also continues to sell firewood from home. On this occasion, Juan is requesting a loan to buy more work materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and nails. He is still a member of the communal bank "Mamacha Rosario" of the Arariwa Association. He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more work materials such as wood, carpenter's glue and nails.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen con esta noble labor. 

Porfirio nació en la ciudad de Huancarani y tiene 35 años de edad, él es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo entonces él tiene una ferretería en su domicilio donde vente diferentes productos como por ejemplo clavos, calaminas, alambres, pinturas y otras cosas más. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como alambres, techos de metal, clavos y otras cosas más. 

Porfirio pertenece  al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Porfirio thanks Kiva lenders for their support and wishes them to continue with their good work. He was born in the city of Huancarani and is 35 years old. He is married and this beautiful relationship has given him seven children. Porfirio is a hardworking and enterprising person who has been able to get his family ahead with much hard work. He has a hardware store in his home where he sells products such as nails, corrugated metal, wire, paint and more. At this time, Porfirio is applying for a loan to buy more merchandise such as wire, metal roofing, nails, etc. Porfirio is a member of the "Mamacha Rosario" communal bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for this opportunity and committed to complying with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as wire,  metal roofing, nails and more.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Felicitas continua viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella continua con la venta de comestibles pues tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella también ahora se está dedicando a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos.  

En esta oportunidad Felicitas requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo aceite, fideos, golosinas, sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.

Felicitas continua en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Felicitas thanks lenders for their support and wishes for them to continue helping all her comrades from Asociación Arariwa. She continues living in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where she performs all types of work. She continues to sell groceries from her small grocery store located in her home. It has already been many years that she has worked in this business, and it has been going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. She is also now dedicated to raising young animals, such as guinea pigs and pigs. At this time, Felicitas requires a loan to buy more merchandise, such as oil, noodles, sweets, bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice, and other things. Felicitas continues in the community bank “Mamacha Rosario” in the microfinance organisation Asociación Arariwa, and she is thankful for the opportunity offered through this group. As a result, she promises to make repayments according to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of sugar, bags of noodles, bags of rice, and other items.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es:
Claudio agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. Claudio vive en la ciudad de Huancarani donde realiza sus actividades familiares y económicas pues él continua con la carpintería  pues es un maestro bien reconocido en la ciudad, él continua con el pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora todo tipo de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, puertas, camas y otras cosas más. Y en esta oportunidad Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo cola, maderas y clavos.

Claudio continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Claudio thanks lenders for their support and wishes for them to continue helping all his comrades from Asociación Arariwa. Claudio lives in the city of Huancarani where he works and has a family. He works in carpentry and is a renowned master of this craft in the city. He has a small shop in his home where he makes a variety of wood furniture such as tables, chairs, doors, beds, and others. Currently, Claudio needs a loan so that he can buy materials such as glue, wood, and nails. Claudio is part of the community bank "Mamacha Rosario" in the Arariwa association. He is thankful for this opportunity and he also promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials for his work such as glue, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es:
Ascencia agradece a los inversionitas por el apoyo brindado y desea que continuen apoyando a todos sus compañeros de la Asociacion Arariwa. 

Ascencia continua viviendo en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividades, ella continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria los días domingos en la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo carnes, verduras, sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, carne y otras cosas más.

Ascencia continúa en el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Ascencia thanks lenders for their support and wishes for them to continue helping all her comrades from Asociación Arariwa. Ascencia still lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, where she does all types of jobs. She still makes a living selling food as a street vendor on Sundays in the city of Huancarani. She has done this job for several years now and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. This time she needs a loan to buy more supplies such as meat, vegetables, sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, and other things. Ascencia continues with Mamacha Rosario Communal Bank in Asociación Arariwa. She's grateful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en: Emilio is 56 years old. He is married with three adult children. He lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is engaged in running a small grocery store. He is also a 'tricycle' driver. He requested a new loan to buy four sacks of rice for retail. He is a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2012. He is striving hard to earn and save for future.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of rice for retail

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 47 years old and widowed with one child.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like spices, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Lorna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like spices, coffee, milk, sugar, chips, etc

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a "buy and sell" vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from "buy and sell" charcoal. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, cream, etc. for her "buy and sell" vegetable business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, cream, etc

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in Pob. Conception, Misamis Occidental. Grace has a 'Sari-sari' store business earning 2,500 PHP a month. She has been in this business for two years. 

Grace requested a new loan to purchase additional inventory items to sell, various goods for her small sari-sari store. Grace has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 9 months. She hopes to succeed in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory items to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 52 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in Conception, Misamis Occidental. Erlinda has a food market business earning a monthly income of 3000 PHP. She has been in this business for three years. Erlinda requested a new loan to pay her child's tuition fee. Erlinda has been a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years. She prays for her child's success.

loans.use: to cover school fees

loans.name: Jeanefer

texts.en:
Jeanefer is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, bread, soap, eggs, noodles, etc for her general store business.

Jeanefer has been in this business for three years. Jeanefer earns more income from pig fattening.

Jeanefer has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, bread, soap, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Salvador Emilio

texts.es: Salvador es un humilde señor, originario de la ciudad de Nueva Segovia. De 59 años de edad, casado y padre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de artículos varios. Inicio en este negocio desde hace 15 años de manera ambulante, luego con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo por medio de sus ahorros logro establecer su negocio en un local donde transitan muchas personas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo. Su expectativa es prosperar en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá mayores ventas e ingresos. Solicita el crédito para comprar accesorios como: cables, controles, tomas, baterías, pegamento, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Salvador is a simple man. Born in Nueva Segovia, he is 59 years old, married, and has three children. He is a businessman and sells a variety of products.

He began his business fifteen years, selling items in the street. Then after much sacrifice and effort, he used his savings to open a business in premises where there is a lot of foot traffic. His son helps him. His hope is that his business will prosper and his quality of life will improve.

Salvador expects this loan will be a great help to him as he will be able to make more sales and increase his income. The loan money will be used to buy cables, remotes, power points, batteries, adhesive, etc. so he can build up the stock in his store and satisfy his customers. His next goal is to improve the building itself.

loans.use: buy accessories such as cables, remotes, power points, batteries, and adhesive

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 41 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom attend school. She operates a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Ligaya is requesting her twentieth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase  feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mar Azul Group

texts.es: Margarita, quien en la fotografía aparece sentada en el sofá, es de pelo corto y claro y botas gris,  pertenece al Banco Comunal Mar Azul de Cañete. En este Banco el principal rubro es la venta de mariscos, ropa y costuras. Margarita vende ropa en el negocio que tiene junto a su marido en donde venden abarrotes. Este negocio lo comenzaron hace aproximadamente 2 años en el cual comenzaron solo vendiendo pescados., ya que ellos son pescadores. El dinero que solicitan es para poder comprar más mercadería para su negocio. Sabe que le irá muy bien con la venta en su negocio. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de encontrar una gran ayuda y unión en el grupo al cual pertenece.
texts.en:
Margarita, who is the woman sitting on the sofa with short, light hair and grey boots, belongs to the Mar Azul del Cañete Communal Bank. In this bank, most of the members sell seafood, clothing, or are seamstresses. 

Margarita sells clothing at the business that she owns with her husband. They also sell groceries. They started this business about 2 years ago and only sold fish, since they are fishermen.

The loan that they have requested will be used to buy more merchandise for their business. She knows that everything will go well with her business' sales.

The thing that she likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that she has found great support and unity in the group to which she belongs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Los Sembradores Group

texts.es: María quien en la fotografía aparece de las primeras en la segunda fila con polerón negro, integra el Banco Comunal Los Sembradores, de Villarrica. En este Banco Comunal el principal rubro es la venta pero de distintos puntos como lo son venta de queso, venta de ropa, venta y fabricación de tejidos, venta de artesanía, también hay repostería y un lugar para paintball. María vende artesanía, hace aproximadamente 14 años y comenzó comprando la artesanía en madera que hacían los internos en las cárceles. Le ha faltado dinero en algunas ocasiones pero ha podido salir adelante. Con el dinero que está solicitando podrá comprar aún más artesanía ya que ha tenido algunos pedidos, es por esto que está segura que le irá muy bien, pero necesita del dinero para ello. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es que existe una entretenida dinámica de grupo siempre.
texts.en:
María, who is one of the first people in the second row of the photo and is wearing a black sweatshirt, is a member of the Los Sembradores communal bank in Villarica. In this group, the most common job is in sales, but there are a variety of positions, like cheese sales, clothing sales, creating and selling weaving, craft sales, and also a pastry shop and a paintball business.

María sells crafts. About 14 years ago, she began purchasing wooden crafts made by prison inmates. She has lacked money at times, but has always been able to move forward.

With the loan that she is requesting, she will be able to purchase even more crafts now that she has has some orders. Due to the recent orders, she is confident that things will go well for her, but she needs the money to invest.

The thing that she enjoys the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is that there is always an enjoyable dynamic within the group.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a married Iraqi client who is 43 years old and has four children. Haydar is the sole provide of the family.

Haydar owns a shop where he sells clothes for women and children. He also sells shampoo, perfumes, hair gels and other cosmetics. He has been running this business since 2012 and is gradually gaining experience through practice. Haydar has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area, thanks to the variety of his offered good with good quality and affordable prices.

Haydar is applying for a loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy more clothes to sell. Haydar is aiming to continuously grow in this field so he may be able to keep providing his family but with better standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop and to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ramthan

texts.en: Ramathan is a hardworking man with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a butcher shop in the market and is thus assured of customers every day. The high cost of animals and lack of adequate capital hinder his business growth while his business plan is to set up other outlets. Ramathan intends to use the loan to buy cows to sell as meat.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Darley

texts.en: Darley is a forty-one-year-old woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She grows flowers for a living and the business has been very lucrative since parties are held almost every weekend and she is the sole supplier in the area. She also earns a salary as a teacher. Diseases and unpredictable weather changes pose a challenge to her business while her desire is to buy land and expand her farming activities. Darley intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase  fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leonora has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase  fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is a hard-working Iraqi married client who is 40 years old and has a child.

Hashem has an office supplies and photocopy shop. He offers his neighborhood photo-copying and document printing services and also sells stationery. He has been providing for his family with the profit from his shop since 2007. Hashem has gained good experience in this field and is well-known by many.

Hashem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to pay the annual rent of his shop. Hashem believes that this loan will give him a chance to continue providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his office supplies shop

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en: Rasul is 31 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past five years, Rasul has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells clothes. To help expand his business, Rasul has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and it will help Rasul to generate greater profits and provide medical care for his children. Rasul hopes that, in the future, he will be able to increase his stock.  Rasul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rasul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for small microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abdugafar

texts.ru:
Абдугафару 45 лет. Он живет в селе Хамадони. Его жена домохозяйка. Два сына учатся в Университете. У Абдугафара рядом с домом имеется собственная пивная, где он в течение 3 лет продает спиртные напитки. Его клиентами являются его соседи и односельчане. Абдугафар кроме спиртных напитков продает там сосиски в тесте и пирожки. Чтобы посетителям было удобно, Абдугафар поставил две колонки, где играет музыка.
   Цель кредита Абдугафара является закуп спиртных напитков, чтобы увеличить выбор продукции в своей пивной. Тогда он найдет больше клиентов.
texts.en: Abdugafar is 45 years old and lives in the village of Hamadoni. His wife is a homemaker and his two sons study at university. Abdugafar has owned a bar close to home for three years. His customers are his neighbors and fellow villagers. He sells sausage rolls and pirozhki in addition to drinks and recently put in a sound system for music to make his customers more comfortable. The purpose of the loan is to purchase liquor in order to expand the drink selection at the bar and attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase liquor and expand the drink selection at his bar.

loans.name: Hakilitoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe HAKILITOYERELA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à Siekourani un des villages de Loulouni  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MARIAM B à l’extrême gauche fait le commerce de fruits et légumes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une importante quantité de fruits et légumes (papaye, bananes, tomate, carotte, concombre, et pastèques) qu’elle revendra en détail à  Loulouni, Siekourani et à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group HAKILITOYERELA are married women, who average 35 years of age and three children each, all living mostly in monogamous families in Siekourani, a village in Loulouni, in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are on their 24th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customer.

Ms. MARIAM B, who at the far left in the photo, does commerce in fruit & vegetables. She intends to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fruit & vegetables (papayas, bananas, tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers, and watermelons), which she will sell retail for cash to men and women customers at a fixed spot and with family help, in Sikasso. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 50,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme SALIMATA assise en première position de la gauche vers la droite fait la préparation et vente de l’encens. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt de la matière première pour la fabrication de l’encens (magnkiseni, parfums, guéni, et bouteilles) qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkadi group are married women, who average 40 years of age with an average of three children each. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working class districts of the town of Sikasso, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region.

They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, in order to be able to satisfy their customers' demand.

Salimata, who is sitting on the far left of the photo makes and sells incense. With her loan she is planning to buy the raw materials needed to make incense ("magnkiseni", perfumes, "guéni", and bottles) which she will retail for cash at a specific place in Sikasso and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest on it, while the remainder will be saved.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making incense.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  Siekourani un des villages de la commune de Loulouni faisant partie de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leurs vingt quatrième prêts avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme MARIAM à l’extrême gauche fait le commerce de fruits et légumes.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt diverses sortes de  fruits et légumes qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Loulouni, Siekourani et à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 52 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Jiguiya group are married women with an average age of 42 years and an average of 4 children each. They live for the most part in monogamous families in Siekourani, one of the villages of the region of Loulouni in the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. The women are on their 24th loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers.

Mariam, pictured on the far left, sells fruits and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to purchase assorted fruits and vegetables which she will resell at retail at the markets in Loulouni, Siekourani, and in Sikasso. She will sell them both from a stand and door to door, for cash to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 52,000 francs CFA, a portion of which will be used to pay back the loan and interest, and the rest for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 21 años, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Miguel se dedica a conducir su mototaxi, para eso sale a las calles de la ciudad en su vehículo en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta dentro y fuera de la ciudad con bastante serenidad y tranquilidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus pasajeros es lo más importante, de la misma manera siempre brinda su numero de celular para que pueda ser contactado por algún cliente que necesita de su servicio de transporte o eventualmente como electricista, es así que pasa sus días entre las calles de la ciudad y las casas a las que acude cuando es requerido para realizar algún servicio de electricidad, su experiencia y la calidad de su trabajo lo coloca como una pieza clave en ambos oficios. Este es segundo crédito con Kiva, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometido una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/. 300, renovará el tapizado y algunos repuestos que su mototaxi necesita para estar en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Miguel is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He drives a motorcycle taxi and goes to the streets looking for passengers with his vehicle. He takes them into and out of the city calmly and peacefully because he believes that the safety of his passengers is what's most important. He always gives his cell phone number out so that customers can call him when they need his transportation service, or on occasion, his services as an electrician. This is how he spends his days - on the city streets and in the houses he goes to when he is needed to do electrical work. His experience and high quality are key components of both endeavors. 

This is his second loan with Kiva and he is grateful to the people who make his loan possible so he can pursue his objectives. He is very committed to making on-time payments once again.  With the amount requested of S/.300, he will buy new upholstery and parts for his vehicle so that it will be in top condition.

loans.use: to buy parts and new upholstery for his vehicle.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe ETOILE sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  AMINATA assise à l’extrême gauche fait le commerce de friperie dans ce groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 2 balles de  friperies qu’elle revendra en détail à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the group ETOILE are married women, who average 40 years of age and five children each, all living mostly in monogamous families in OUAYERMA I, a working-class district of Sikasso City, in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are on their sixth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customer.

Ms. AMINATA, who is sitting at the far left, does commerce in secondhand clothing in this group. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 bales of used clothing, which she will sell retail for cash to men and women customers at a fixed spot with family in Sikasso. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit 35,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits is used to pay back the loan with interest, and the other part goes to her savings.

loans.use: to purchase secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Gloria Leticia

texts.es: Gloria tiene 57 años de edad y habita en casa propia desde hace 10 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora quien no se cansa de trabajar. Tiene 35 años de dedicarse al comercio de flores artesanales y a la siembra de frijoles y maíz. Muchas personas dan buena referencia de ella dentro de su comunidad ya que es una mujer muy respetuosa y responsable. Ella desea construir un cuarto para dormitorio dentro de su terreno que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado conseguir. Para esto solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder contar con este apoyo y hacer el dormitorio lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and she has lived in her own home for the past 10 years. She is an entrepreneurial woman who never gets tired of working. For 35 years, she has made a living by selling artisan flowers and growing beans and corn. Many people in her community speak very highly of her since she is a respectful and responsible woman.

She would like to build a room for a dormitory on her land, which she has been able to obtain with great effort. For this, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails. She hopes that she can count on this help and build the dormitory as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to build a room for a dormitory.

loans.name: Tileneya Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe TILENEYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme DJELIKA à l’extrême gauche fait le commerce  de produits de beauté .
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt des produits de beauté qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Ouayerma à Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the group called Tileneya are married women who are on average 45 years old with five children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Ouayermai, which is one of the popular neighbourhoods of the town of Sikasso, which is in the third administrative region of Mali.
This is their fifth loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution as they try to satisfy their customers' needs.
Mrs. Djelika is on the far left, she sells beauty products.
With her loan she plans to buy cosmetics. She will sell them retail at the market in Ouayerma, in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women, for cash. She works in a stall with her family.
She plans to make a monthly profit of 20 000 francs CFA some of which will be used to repay the loan and the interests and the remainder she will save.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is  married and has three children who attend school. She has a business of selling charcoal, which she has been doing for years. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works both at the market and from home seven days a week and sells on both a retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Eva is requesting a loan from MCDT SACCO for 1,000,000 Uganda shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She hopes to own a delivery van to ease her transportation costs and to sell on a wholesale basis only.  She resides in the family house where she has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utility bills

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Roxana Yanet

texts.es: Roxana de 36 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos. Ella y su esposo trabajan duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Roxana se dedica a la preparación y venta de ricas pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, queso y frijoles), de esta forma colabora con la economía de su hogar. Su principal patrimonio es su  humilde vivienda para la cual solicita este  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y puertas para construir pared de división dentro de su casa y asegurar el cuarto con una puerta, espera poder contar con este apoyo y así dar a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Roxana is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her children. She and her husband work hard to help their family to get ahead.

Roxana earns a living by preparing and selling delicious pupusas (a food made with corn flour, cheese, and beans). This allows her to contribute to her household's finances. 

Roxana's main asset is her humble home. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, and doors, so that she can build a dividing wall in her home, and secure the room using a door. She hopes that she will get this loan, and provide her family with better security in this way.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and doors to build a dividing wall in her house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has five children. The oldest is 18, while the youngest is 2. Her husband works as a construction worker to support their family. She offers manicure and pedicure services. Her business started four years ago. Aside from cosmetology services, she makes peanut butter, to augment their income. She is applying for a loan to buy more ingredients (peanuts) and cooking utensils, in order to produce more and increase sales.  In the future, Josephine hopes to expand both her businesses and increase their profitability, to provide funds for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and cooking utensils to make peanut butter to sell.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Mr. Batbayar is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children under nine years old in a Ger (felt tent) in the Harhorin district of Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His two older children go to primary school locally. His wife, Delgermaa, takes care of their two youngest children, who are of 3 and 1. Batbayar has been working at a local furniture manufacturing company since 2002. He started his own business at home in 2011, and he is now planning to build a small workplace on his plot of land. He is applying for a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase planks and other materials to use in producing wooden furniture for his clients. He is talented and hardworking young man.

loans.use: to purchase planks and other materials to produce wooden furniture for his customers.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a 30-year-old married woman from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. She works the land and grows rice. Aside from farming, she runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells various items like noodles, canned goods, coffee, sugar, biscuits, and detergent, to help augment the income of their household. Her farming business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and various groceries like beverages, condiments and soft drinks.

In the future, she hopes to expand her both business and increase business profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and various groceries like beverages, condiments and soft drinks

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 55 years old  from Panglao, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various items such as eggs, canned goods, noodles, mineral soap, and toiletries, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Celsa is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy soft drinks, beverages, and other dry goods. In the future, she hopes to expand her retail store business and increase profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beverages, and other dry goods

loans.name: Fredelie

texts.en:
Fredelie has been a hog raiser for more than 25 years. She is widowed with one child. Aside from raising hogs, she also has 50 chickens and 100 ducks she raises to sell. Fredelie has no family member living with her anymore so she devotes her time to raising livestock.  

Fredelie is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 which will allow her to buy 35 bags of hog feed and vitamins to ensure proper nutrition of her hogs, chicken and ducks. She hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted. In this way, she could keep her livestock and poultry animals healthy which is necessary for getting a good price for them.

loans.use: to buy 35 bags of hog feed and vitamins to ensure proper nutrition of her hogs, chicken and ducks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas has a tailoring business and has been running it for three years. She is 55 years old and married and together with her husband they have three children aged 25, 22 and 15 years old. 

This being her first loan, she plans to use the amount to buy more materials for sewing. These include textile materials, threads, buttons  and needles. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock as well as repay the loan.

In future Dorcas hopes to install electricity in her home as well as educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more materials for sewing.
